name: Doreen
description: Doreen is a citizen ofBlackwater. According to her husband, her father was a bully and a drunk. At some point, she thought about marrying a man namedBurt Sackett, who was, apparently, quite fat. With her husband, she had two daughters; one was mauled byundead.

name: Silas
description: Silas appears in the survivormission"Curious Tales from Blackwater". He is with a group of survivors and argues withArchibald Andrewsover who is the leader. During the argument,Lucille Billingsgateis attacked and the rest of the group flees. He can be killed after theundeadhave attacked.

name: Mary Lou
description: Mary Lou appears at the party thrown bySeth BriarsatThe Old Bacchus Placein the final cutscene of themission"Get Back in That Hole, Partner". The player does not interact with her but watches asSethdances a jig with her. As she is the same as all the otherundeadthere, if you throw an explosive weapon such as aFire BottleorDynamite, the Undead will attack or be killed.

name: Winona Picket
description: Winona can most often be found wandering aroundArmadillo. However, she has been known to frequentBlackwater, as well as other locations throughoutNew AustinandWest Elizabeth.

name: Mordecai Robbard's niece
description: Marston finds her hiding in theTailor'sshop. She is hiding from theUndeadand is visibly frightened. She claims that her mother killed her father - despite the fact that her mother had died of smallpox three years earlier.

name: Mummies
description: Mummies only appear in theEscalera Catacombs. They are long-dead Aztecs, possibly slaves, who were sacrificed during an ancient period. They are beyond recognition of gender; they are just shambling grayish creatures. It will be difficult to kill them due to the dark nature of the catacombs and they can only be differentiated by the red eyes they have. A good way to annihilate them is by using theDead Eye.

name: Ayauhtéotl
description: Ayauhtéotl was the Aztec being, force or Goddess who controlled mist, smoke and most particularly Crepuscular rays, the dark and light beams that appear under the right condition at sunset. She was also the Goddess of fame and glory.

name: Millicent Waterbury
description: She is the first person to be located in theSide-mission"Missing Souls", which serves as an introduction to theMissing Personsactivity. She is found trapped inPleasance House, which has been surrounded by an undead horde, and terribly frightened. Upon seeing Marston through the window, she shouts for his help, and, with a cry of "Hey! Stop that! Now!", Marston kills the zombies surrounding the house. She must then be returned toFort Mercer.

name: Herbert Moon
description: Herbert Moon is the owner of theGeneral Storein the town ofArmadilloinCholla Springs,New Austin. He had a brother named Francis Moon, who died on 23 May 1897, and is buried inCoot's Chapelcemetery, with his tombstone saying he "always took a joke too far". Herbert also has a daughter named Herberta, whom he disowned after she married a Jewish man named Isaac Solomons, and dedicated herself to helping the poor instead of selling groceries.

name: Mintie Cummings
description: Mintie can often be found inArmadillo, going about her daily business, but can occasionally be found in other towns inNew Austin. However, she can also be found atThe Old Bacchus Place, where she appears to live withTheodore Eaves. She is also found atRidgewood Farm, where she also seems to live, even sleeping there, along withGladys FeaneyandEunis Randle.

name: Mother Superior Calderón
description: Sister Calderón had a husband who, prior to 1899, "died a long time ago", including a mother. Her mother gave her a crucifix when she was a novice, shortly before she passed away.Sister Calderón became a nun based in the city ofSaint Denisat some point prior to 1899. She moved to Mexico in late 1899, by boarding a train atEmerald Station. Her reasoning for moving to Mexico was that she was "finally sent on a mission", presumably by thechurch.
